text: Ljubuški is a town and municipality in Bosnia and Herzegovina. It is in the West Herzegovina Canton, a unit of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina. == Demographics == === Ljubuški Municipality === Municipality Year 2013 1991 1981 1971 Croats 27.271 (96.76%) 26.127 (92.19%) 25.334 (91.77%) 26.198 (92.67%) Bosniaks 707 (2.51%) 1.592 (5,61%) 1.498 (5.42%) 1.812 (6.40%) Serbs 41 (0.15%) 65 (0.22%) 83 (0.30%) 118 (0.41%) Yugoslavs 227 (0.80%) 515 (1.86%) 49 (0.17%) Others 165 (0.59%) 329 (1.16%) 173 (0.62%) 92 (0.32%) Total 28.184 28.340 27.603 28.269 === Ljubuški populated place === Ljubuški Year 1991 1981 1971 Croats 2.658 (63.31%) 2.164 (58.48%) 1.328 (47.36%) Moslems 1.174 (27.96%) 1.037 (28.02%) 1.308 (46.64%) Serbs 53 (1.26%) 51 (1.37%) 88 (3.13%) Yugoslavs 180 (4.28%) 413 (11.16%) 43 (1.53%) Others 133 (3.16%) 35 (0.94%) 37 (1.31%) Total 4.198 3.700 2.804 == References == == Other websites == * Ljubuški official webpage * www.ljubuski.info * www.ljubusaci.com * www.ljubuski.com Category:Settlements in Bosnia and Herzegovina
